cards.flavor_text: [i]“Nao may be gone, Potomok, but you are my brother through his bond with Daja. Do not make me level my blade against family.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Haste

Vigilance

Whenever you gain life, put a +1/+1 counter on Potomok.

Ward—Gift three cards

Whenever an opponent attacks, if they attacked you, a planeswalker you control, or a battle you defend, scry 1, then scry 1.

cards.rules_text:

cards.flavor_text: [i]His blade and spirit shattered, Nao left everything behind to seek distant shores.[/i]

cards.flavor_text:
[i]“The mighty will fall so that we can rise; so that we can be mighty.”
- Potomok Slavanaroda[/i]

cards.rules_text: Attacking creatures must attack this battle if able. Whenever a creature deals damage to this battle, this battle's defender loses that much life and you gain that much life.
cards.rules_text2:
Destroy all creatures. Then choose one —
• Gain 2 life for each creature destroyed this way.
• Scry X, where X is the number of creatures destroyed this way.
• Add {B} to your mana pool for each creature destroyed this way.
• Return each creature with flying destroyed this way from the graveyard to its owner's hand.
cards.notes:
Hexmage UB into Lona Brood (conquerors) UBW and Laka Brood (rebels) UBR — diasporic split
Starborn BR into Fatespinner Brood (hedonism) BRW and Itinerant Brood (nihilism) BRG — sworn enemies
Judicator BG into Ronin Brood (enforcers) BGW and Shogun Brood (legislators) BGU — caste divide

cards.flavor_text: [i]In a final test of hubris, even once-human immortals were branded heretic and raided for the secrets of Weizza.[/i]
cards.rules_text2:
Enchant legendary creature
Enchanted creature is indestructible, has hexproof, and is a God in addition to its other creature types.
Humans you control have lifelink, skulk, haste, and deathtouch.

cards.rules_text: When Seven Days War enters, modified creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain first strike and trample. [i](Equipment, Auras you control, and counters are modifications.)[/i]
cards.flavor_text: [i]When it came time to vanquish the Saming, the Saming decided the best way forward was to return the favor.[/i]

cards.rules_text: [i]Radiance[/i] — When Storming the Drownyards enters, tap target creature and each creature that shares a color with it. Put a stun counter on each creature an opponent controls that was tapped this way.
cards.rules_text2:
Enchant opponent
Whenever enchanted player untaps a permanent, scry 1.
cards.flavor_text2:
[i]“You accuse us of drowning your youth, who stumbled drunk into our homes. May you eternally stumble drunk on our blood into a future that drowns your weeping children.”
- Dene, Queen of the Rusalka[/i]

cards.rules_text: When Betrayal at Khona Crossing enters, destroy target nonland permanent. Its controller may search their library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle.
cards.rules_text2:
When Nāgablood Serum enters, draw a card.
{1}, {T}, Discard a card, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.
Whenever another Potion or Blood you control enters, you may put a +1/+1 counter on up to one target creature.

cards.rules_text: When Sinking of the Last Fleet enters, it deals X X damage to each creature without flying, where X is the number of cards you have scried this turn.
cards.rules_text2: Whenever a creature with flying or landwalk attacks you or a battle you defend, Last Song of the Patupaiarehe deals 4 damage to it.
cards.flavor_text2: [i]“You have destroyed the last pilgrims of Autumn even while they fled and cried mercy, may your voyages from these shores be met with the same despair.”[/i]

cards.rules_text: When Poka Forest Hunt enters, you may destroy up to one target creature with flying. If no creature is destroyed this way, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control with flying.
cards.rules_text2: Destroy up to one target artifact and up to one target enchantment.
cards.flavor_text2: [i]Destroying the hākuturi was as easy as setting a wildfire — once the forest was ablaze, the rest of its guardians were sent into a frenzy.[/i]

cards.rules_text: When Rout at Aitu-Whare enters, scry 3, then fateseal 3, then each player mills three cards.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Word spread of a final holdout of kitsune that had fled to the shrine at Aitu-Whare. Perfect information was necessary to ensure that none escaped this time.[/i]
cards.rules_text2:
Ward—Mill nine cards [i](Whenever this permanent becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, counter it unless that player mills nine cards.)[/i]
You may have Kitsune Fugitive enter as a copy of any creature card in a graveyard, except it's a 3/3 blue Spirit with “Ward—mill nine cards” in addition to its other colors and types.

cards.rules_text:
Flash
When Breaking of Shin Onryu enters, it deals damage to target attacking or blocking creature equal to the number of artifacts you control and you gain that much life.

cards.flavor_text: [i]The Mavudai were not of this realm, and so banishing them was as simple as closing the curtains on liminal spaces.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Return target creature from your graveyard to your hand. If that creature died this turn, you may sacrifice a creature to return it to the battlefield instead.
cards.flavor_text: [i]The nāga selflessly sacrificed many proud fighters in the Seven Days War, which made the Khona Crossing Massacre a much simpler affair for the Alliance.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]The hearts of the Great Dunes remained, even after Netra's controlled flooding; reminders that even while we seek to shape nature, what is meant to be will be.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Flying
When Ancient Red Dragon deals combat damage to a player, roll a d20. Ancient Red Dragon deals damage equal to the result to each opponent.

When Ancient Black Dragon deals combat damage to target player, roll a d20. Creatures your opponents control get -X/-X this turn, where X is the result.

Flying
When Ancient Blue Dragon deals combat damage to a player, roll a d20. Each creature that player controls gets -X/-0 until your next turn, where X is the result.

Flying
Whenever Ancient White Dragon deals combat damage to a player, roll a d20. You may distribute a number of stun counters equal to the result among creatures they control.

Flying
When Ancient Green Dragon deals combat damage to a player, roll a d20. You gain life equal to the result.

cards.flavor_text: [i]You will never know you have encountered Kiritsu Ichika until you are already dead.[/i]

cards.flavor_text:
[i]“I help souls along to a place where they can find peace from the prying hands of the living.”
- Hitomi, Shinigame of Aitu-Whare[/i]

cards.rules_text:

Sacrifice Hexmage Ambusher: Remove all counters from target permanent.

When a creature Manhunter's Companion is paired with dies, transform Manhunter's Companion.
cards.flavor_text2: [i]The humans thought he would flee when his kitsune master died, but it was too late. He swore to avenge him or die trying.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Defender
When a creature Bloodsport Survivor dealt damage to dies this turn, transform it.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Folk and beast alike were forced into the ring for Vritrahi's amusement. Only the hungriest would leave.[/i]
cards.rules_text2: Bloodthirsty Saming attacks each combat if able.
cards.flavor_text2: [i]Some were too successful, and became something greater in their lust for flesh.[/i]

cards.flavor_text2: [i]She was a fearless hunter with a taste for human flesh. Now as a saming, she kills for sport as well.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]If a mavudai requires payment of a firstborn, they are typically not interested in waiting around.[/i]

cards.flavor_text:

cards.rules_text: {2}: Radiant Fist Adept deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Disciples of Potomok Slavanaroda fought with bare fists, often augmenting punches with bursts of light.[/i]

cards.rules_text: {2}: Scry 2. [i](Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom and the rest on top in any order.)[/i]
cards.flavor_text: [i]Disciples of Dephong Yen use their minds to see the future and touch the present.[/i]

cards.rules_text: {2}: Create a Blood token. [i](It's an artifact with “{1}, {T}, Discard a card, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.”)[/i]
cards.flavor_text: [i]Often reduced to the most efficient vessel, disciples of the Three control the most dangerous element of them all — life itself.[/i]

cards.rules_text: {2}: Add {S}{S}{S}. Use this mana only to activate abilities of snow permanents and artifacts you control.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Disciples of Netra Choolha could heat metal by sucking the ambient heat from the desert air. Often, forges were only ever lit in the dead of winter.[/i]

cards.rules_text: {2}: Target creature gains or loses flying this turn.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Disciples of Zhongli Tian Kuo were taught that power was everything, and none more important than the power over heaven and earth.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]Though vampires, Azdaja's brood could tolerate the light of the three suns, mingling freely with their prey.[/i]

cards.rules_text: {1}{B}, Sacrifice an artifact or creature: Target opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Daywalkers were taught the art of blood without the accompanying philosophy.[/i]

Flying

cards.flavor_text: [i]The hākuturi took great pride as guardians of nature, even if it put them at odds with humans and dragons.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]Not all hākuturi take a passive role in keeping the forest safe.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]Quilin can be harbingers of death, but also heralds of triumph.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]Forever seeking leads to the mythical philosopher's stone, zawgyi were also quick to defend their findings from those outside the order.[/i]

- Mata, Summer Isle suncaller[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]The Osvescov tribe are hardy tundra folk that live on the southern Os Steppe. They paid tribute to the dragon lord Zharzimaj.[/i]
[i]The Bakali live on the shores of Lake Kalai, in the contested lands between Zharzimaj and Shiryu.[/i]
[i]In the southern woodlands and bogs, the Tenku live and work in Shiryu's strongholds and villages.[/i]
[i]The Wuxia swore fealty to Han Loong willingly and enjoyed a cushy life in his woodland cities.[/i]
[i]Lamvians, people of the northern bogs, tended the rice fields for Han Lacuan.[/i]
[i]The Khona, people of the bog, lived and studied under Myanaga's court of dragon sages.[/i]
[i]Life in the Prash Dunes was difficult, but the Prasi endured the rule of Vritrahi enough to get by.[/i]
[i]The Vedani lived in the lush jungles where Vritrahi feared to tread, fearing the wrath of the Han siblings.[/i]
[i]Living on the archipelago, the Roata were under the protection of Kumiwhare.[/i]
